reviewText: If you are a fan of this film series I would not suggest getting this set (there is a much better set with a little higher quality for salePuppet Master Collection) but if you have never seen the series before, this is a great set.  The plot is simple -- master puppeteer Andre Toulon has come up with a serum that makes puppets work with out strings.  The Nazi party wants this serum and will do anything to get it -- including Toulon.  (at least this is shown in great detail in Puppet Master 3)  In Puppet Master 1 we see Toulon's death then it comes to present day and a group of Paranormal researchers are brought to the hotel where Toulon dies in search of what caused the death of a fellow researcher.  The Puppets do not realize that the Nazi Party has been eliminated for quite some time and go on a rampage to kill anyone that may be attempting to get hold of the secret that gives the puppets life.A Great scarefest for all.  This DVD though has not been digitally remastered to the highest standards (unlikePuppet Master Collection), but the VHS to DVD conversion is not bad.  A good find either way.
summary: Not that bad of a collection.

reviewText: I thought this was a bargain for our Halloween season.  We like to mix it up with older and newer movies, and we enjoyed the Puppet Master movies back in college.  I guess by today's standards the movies would seem tame, but we enjoyed them then and enjoy them now.

reviewText: Decent series of the first three Puppet Master films by Full Moon stidios. About killing dolls. Barbara Crampton makes an appearance in the first film. Takes place in 1939 then goes to the present. Third film goes from 1941 to present. Not nad.

reviewerName: Low-Ranking Reviewer "tell it like it is"
reviewText: bought this 1-disc, "midnight horror puppet master" set for only $5 at kmart.  for that price i'm happy with it.  the problem is all three are in fullscreen, low-quality looking dvds(echo bridge entertainment) with only one extra feature- "the making of puppet master 3".  all 3 are r-rated with varying gore and 1 brief sex scene each.  if that sounds ok and you see it cheap go for it, especially if you're a casual fan(like me) or a newcomer to the series.  for diehards, a better collection is available.quick rundown:PM1- the original is pretty good.  it does a decent job of getting you interested in these puppets and makes you want to see future installments.  the human actors are bland, but they don't ruin the movie.  BPM2- the human actors almost ruin this one though.  very bland characters and the plot was too run-of-the-mill for me.  its ok at best.  CPM3- my favorite of the bunch.  2 reasons.  set during ww2, you cant beat puppets vs nazis.  plus, you get some good performances by the main 3 in guy rolfe, ian abercrombie, and richard lynch(all immediately recognizable faces playing it straight).  my favorite scene in the whole movie was actually a dialogue scene near the end between toulon and hess.  as a bonus, this film explains the origins so newcomers can actually start with this to see if the series & puppets appeal to them.  A
summary: if you can find it cheap, go for it
Title: N/A

reviewText: For the price you can't really complain about the movies being in full screen.  The company doesn't divulge that fact on the packaging but I suspected as much.  Considering the fact that you can't really find these movies at retail unless you really go hunting for one of the box sets this is what you end up with: watchable transfers for a cheap price.  It's not rocket science; these are horrible hilarious movies that you can watch multiple times without thinking too deeply about them.  In fact, I recall a time when puppet master 3 was incredibly difficult to find (outside the box set) on both vhs and dvd so the inclusion of that movie is reason enough to buy this dvd.
summary: Good value for under-appreciated b movies.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was surprise when I came cross Midnight Horror 1 at FYE for a price as low as $7.  I have to admit that not seeing the first 5 films since it first came out the plots sort of blended together in my mind. Especially since movies 1,2 and 4 all deals with a group of people going to an abandoned hotel. The only major flaw I found in this set is a lack of bonus features except a video zone on Puppet master 3. I especially like it when movie trailer is included.  The picture quality here was a vast improvement over the Trancer trilogy  release in the same format as this.Puppet Master one sort of make me think of first Friday the 13th movie. Just as first Friday the 13th had Jason mother was the killer instead of Jason himself the first Puppet master doesn't have the true Puppet master but a Phychic who tricks his fellow psychics to the hotel and use the puppets he found in the hotel to seek revenge. A great start to the series than only improves from here.Puppet Master 2 the true Puppet master Toulon is risen from the grave by his beloved puppets. The Puppets need him to recreate the formula that give them life with the help of the brain matter of those who come to the hotel to investigate the deaths of the psychics in the first movie. Toulon in this movie also talk about the death of his wife in this movie which is a lead in for the third movie of the franchise.Puppet Master 3 takes place during World War 2 where the Nazi's learn about Toulon's special puppets and want to use his secret to re-animate their fallen soldiers into an unstoppable killing force.  When the Gestapo kill his beloved wife Toulon and his puppets take on a mission mixture of revenge and justice as they go after the Nazi responsible.While I know there are more expensive versions of these film release with extras to them but if its the movies themselves that is important to you then this is a good collection at a good price.
